speaker: Outstanding Writing for a Comedy Series
text: Joe Keenan  * * *  ## Transcript {Mike Lee}    _ACT ONE Scene One -- KACL Frasier has just finished his show.  Roz comes in from her booth. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh well, good show today, Roz.  I particularly thought that--
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Writing for a Comedy Series

speaker: Roz
text: Oh my God, there's that Connie from Promotions.  Every time she sees me, she hits me up for another charity.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Roz, maybe it's time you set some limits.  Good lord, how hard can it be to say "no" just once?  Oh well, look who I'm talking to.

speaker: Connie
text: Hi, Frasier.  Roz, I was looking for you--

speaker: Roz
text: O.K. wait, Connie, before you say anything, there's something I need to get off my chest.  I have bought Girl Scout cookies from you, I have paid for your kids' band uniforms, I've bought tickets to every raffle your church ever had, and I'm tapped out.  So whatever it is you came to say to me, I'm not interested.

speaker: Connie
text: Well, I'll just go then. [_turns to leave, then_] Oh, by the way, my church had its raffle drawing yesterday.  You won the grand prize. [_drops an envelope on the console_] Sorry to bother you.

speaker: Roz
text: [_calling after her_] Oh, Connie, Connie, I'm sorry, Connie, don't -- oh, who cares, what'd I win?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh my God!  It's that free ski weekend!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Roz!

speaker: Roz
text: Listen to this: "Dear winner, you will enjoy a one-weekend rental of a deluxe private ski lodge on Mt. Baker, complete with lessons from a former Olympic champ!"

speaker: Frasier
text: That is a grand prize indeed!  I must admit, I'm just a bit envious.  Well, listen, I hope you have a wonderful weekend.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, thank you, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Just seems a pity you won't be able to take advantage of those ski lessons.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, there'll be other stuff to do.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, tons, tons!  Just because you can't ski -- or for that matter hike, sled, or snowboard -- doesn't mean you can't still curl up in by a roaring fire with a nice warm snifter of... oh, sorry.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, the scenery will be nice.

speaker: Frasier
text: Breathtaking!  I just hope you can endure the four-hour drive up there, and you so carsick these days...

speaker: Roz
text: OK, Frasier, I know what you're hinting at.  This is the first thing I have ever won in my entire life, and it means something to me.  So I'm not going to sell it, or give it away, or trade it for a...

speaker: Frasier
text: Big-screen TV?

speaker: Roz
text: Key's in the envelope.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you. _He takes the envelope and leaves.  FADE OUT  Scene Two -- Frasier's Apartment -- Night Martin is watching a baseball game on TV.  The sound is turned up very loud.  The doorbell rings, and Daphne crosses the room with a basket of laundry. _

speaker: Daphne
text: What do you need that so loud for?  I swear you've gone deaf as a post!

speaker: Martin
text: It's just a cold stopping up my ears, I'll be fine.

speaker: Niles
text: Dear God, man, whose lawyer are you, anyway?  No, I will not calm down! [_coming in_] They call that a settlement?  You call them and turn it down. [_louder, over TV_] I said, turn it down, you ninny!

speaker: Martin
text: Geez, you could at least ask nicely!

speaker: Niles
text: I've got to get a new divorce lawyer.  Claude is clearly no match for Maris's team.

speaker: Daphne
text: Real sharks, are they?

speaker: Niles
text: When we were courting, I sent Maris a valentine that said, "You're the girl my heart adores, Everything I have is yours." Now they're calling it a pre-nup.

speaker: Daphne
text: That's terrible! [_to Martin_] Can you imagine using that as a weapon -- an old valentine?

speaker: Martin
text: I'd love a cold Ballantine!

speaker: Daphne
text: That does it!  You're getting a hearing aid, whether you like it or not!

speaker: Martin
text: I don't need a hearing aid!  My hearing will be back to normal in no time.

speaker: Daphne
text: You said that two days ago.  Soon you won't be able to hear a word I say.

speaker: Martin
text: Gee, wouldn't that be a tragedy?

speaker: Martin
text: [_taking a shot_] I heard that.

speaker: Daphne
text: I didn't say anything!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, what are you all loitering around here for when you should all be packing?

speaker: Daphne
text: Packing for what?

speaker: Frasier
text: For the fabulous ski weekend I'm taking us on!

speaker: Niles
text: You're kidding!  You won the raffle?

speaker: Frasier
text: In a manner of speaking.  It's a gorgeous ski lodge, and an Olympic champion in residence to give us lessons!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, sounds like heaven!  Skiing all weekend, then warming up with a nice hot rum drink, curled up under a blanket in front of a roaring fire...

speaker: Niles
text: I can feel the steam rising off my toddy already.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, damn!  I can't go.

speaker: Niles
text: [_alarmed_] Why not?

speaker: Daphne
text: My friend Annie.  It's her birthday this weekend, and I promised I'd spend it with her.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, bring her along.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I know she'd love it.  She's very gung-ho for sports. She was captain of the girls' rugby team at school.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm not sure how many bedrooms there are.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, if we're short, she can have mine.

speaker: Daphne
text: Where will you sleep?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I'll think of something.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_to Frasier_] Are you sure you wouldn't mind?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh well, yes, why not?  I mean, what could be more fun than a gung-ho girls' rugby captain?

speaker: Frasier
text: I will kill you for this!

speaker: Niles
text: I'm sorry, but it was the only way Daphne was going to come, and if you think I was going to let a moonlit ski lodge go to waste, you can think again.

speaker: Frasier
text: You filed for divorce a week ago.  Can't you wait awhile?

speaker: Niles
text: Wait?  I have waited five long years for this.  Dad, don't you think it's about time?

speaker: Martin
text: [_checking his watch_] Uh, I got ten after five.

speaker: Frasier
text: Listen, Niles, if you want to make a fool of yourself with Daphne, that is your affair.  But frankly, I will not have you ruin my ski weekend by inviting along this girl that sounds to me like an avalanche risk!  I'm going to tell Daphne, no guests!

speaker: Daphne
text: I called Annie.  She's all excited.  Turns out she just bought new skis with the money she made off her new swimsuit calendar.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I hope you're happy.  We're stuck with her now. _Even as he speaks, he's unable to keep the smile off his face, or the gleam out of his eye.  FADE TO:  Scene Three -- Ski Lodge -- Day The lodge has a living and dining room area with a fireplace.  Off this is a small kitchen.  Another downstage door leads to a bedroom.  Doors leading to two more bedrooms face each other upstage.  Stairs beyond this lead to a second floor landing with doors to three more bedrooms.  Niles and Martin, wearing winter outfits, enter carrying luggage. _

speaker: Niles
text: Wow, look at this place!

speaker: Martin
text: Wow, look at this place!  Nothing like a change of scenery, huh? [_looks around_] Where do you suppose the TV is?

speaker: Niles
text: At this altitude, I'm surprised my ears haven't stopped up. How's it affecting your ears, Dad?

speaker: Niles
text: Dad?

speaker: Martin
text: What?

speaker: Niles
text: How are your ears?

speaker: Martin
text: [_covering badly_] Great!  Never been better!  No hearing aid for me! _Niles turns away.  Martin madly flexes his jaw to pop his ears, without success.  Frasier comes in with more luggage._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_calling back over his shoulder_] No need to struggle with that, Annie.  I'll be back to help you in a moment.  Oh, this place is terrific!

speaker: Niles
text: Yes.  I'm just glad we got here alive.  The way you were taking those curves so sharply, poor Annie kept getting thrown up against you.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_naughtily_] Well, what can I say?  I'm a bad driver.

speaker: Niles
text: I grant you she's comely, but don't you find her a tad -- what would the polite euphemism be -- stupid?

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, she is just unschooled, like Liza Doolittle.  Find her the right Henry Higgins, she'll be ready for a ball in no time!

speaker: Niles
text: Leave it to you to put the "pig" back in "Pygmalion."

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you. _Daphne and Annie -- a blond, British woman in her twenties with a supermodel figure -- enter with the last of the luggage. _

speaker: Daphne
text: Goodness, this place is just lovely!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, isn't it, though? [_motioning out the window_] I mean, look at that vista, it's stunning!  Puts one in mind of the Matterhorn, doesn't it?

speaker: Annie
text: Oh, I wouldn't know.  I'm not very musical. _Niles gives Frasier a look.  Martin opens an Igloo cooler and pulls out two large bottles of rum._

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, that's a relief!  The way you were swerving on the ride up here, I was afraid these'd get broken.  I'm gonna make us all a batch of my special hot buttered rum!

speaker: Frasier
text: You're actually going to put butter in the rum?

speaker: Martin
text: It's cold in the mountains, you need a little fat in your booze.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good thinking, Dad.  After we're done, I'll whip us up a nice batch of pork-nog.

speaker: Annie
text: None for me, thanks, I'm a vegetarian.

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne, let me help you with your luggage.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, thank you.

speaker: Niles
text: Uh, which room do you want?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh... [_points_] That one upstairs on the left should have a nice view.

speaker: Niles
text: What a coincidence, that's right next to mine.

speaker: Annie
text: Oh, I'll take the one next to that.

speaker: Frasier
text: Allow me. _Frasier takes Annie's bags and exits with Niles, leaving the two women alone._

speaker: Annie
text: That Niles is quite a cutey.  Now he's the one getting divorced?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah.  Poor thing's been just miserable.

speaker: Annie
text: Well, I may just have to cheer him up.

speaker: Daphne
text: You just leave Dr. Crane alone.  No offense, but I've seen the way you go through men.  The last thing he needs is for someone else to break his heart. _As Daphne speaks, she zips up the front of Annie's jumpsuit, covering her more-than-slightly exposed cleavage._

speaker: Annie
text: But it's my birthday!  And besides, you're not his nanny. _Unseen by them, Guy, their ski instructor, enters with a bag of groceries.  He's darkly tanned, French, and very good-looking._

speaker: Daphne
text: Can't we just have a nice relaxing ski trip?  Does this whole trip have to be about sex?

speaker: Guy
text: _Allo._ _Daphne turns around -- and blushes. _

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello.

speaker: Guy
text: I am Guy.

speaker: Daphne
text: Daphne.

speaker: Annie
text: Annie.

speaker: Guy
text: I hope you are ready to ski tomorrow.  I'm going to work you very hard.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh! [_giggling_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Dibs on the Frenchman.

speaker: Annie
text: You can have him.

speaker: Annie
text: He's not half as cute as Dr. Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, enough already, my ears are burning!

speaker: Daphne
text: Everyone, did you meet Guy, our ski instructor?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_shakes hands_] Hello, Guy.

speaker: Guy
text: I will also be your chef tonight, _Entrec�te a la Guy._

speaker: Niles
text: A ski champion and a gourmet -- _vous etes tr�s formidable._

speaker: Guy
text: _Parlez-vous francais?_

speaker: Niles
text: _Oui, j'ai habit e � six mois � Paris quand j'etais un etudiant._

speaker: Guy
text: You speak very well.

speaker: Annie
text: _Oui!_

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, you speak French as well?

speaker: Annie
text: No, all I know how to say is "_oui._ "

speaker: Frasier
text: [_naughtily_] Well, that should be enough to get you through the weekend.

speaker: Martin
text: Aw, look at that.  Two deer in the snow, just kind of nuzzling each other.

speaker: Daphne
text: How romantic.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, it's enough to put ideas in one's head.

speaker: Annie
text: Isn't it?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes.

speaker: Daphne
text: I should say so.

speaker: Guy
text: _Absolument._ _Guy leans back and steals a glance at Niles's butt.  Then they all go back to staring out the window._

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I guess I'd better start that rum cooking. _END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO_ **COULD GUY'S LAST NAME BE FEYDEAU?** _Scene Four -- Ski Lodge -- Night After dinner.  Guy is stoking the fire.  Daphne hovers over him, while Annie is on the couch with a mug of hot rum._

speaker: Daphne
text: Look at you -- you're handy, a chef, a ski champ.  Is there anything you don't do?

speaker: Guy
text: There are a few things.

speaker: Guy
text: Oh, Niles, you look _tr�s elegant!_

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, I simply had to change.  After all that wine and good food, I felt I was going to burst out of my trousers.

speaker: Annie
text: Ooh, my!

speaker: Daphne
text: Annie. _Frasier comes out of his room, also in pajamas and a dressing gown that's a little more garish than Niles's._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Dr. Crane, what a smashing robe!

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_to Annie_] Doesn't he look handsome?

speaker: Annie
text: [_uninterested_] Oh, yeah, quite.  Oh, look -- I've finished my buttered rum.

speaker: Frasier
text: Never let it be said that Frasier Crane would permit a lady to go thirsty.  Daphne, why don't you see if Dad's finished with that second batch? _Daphne takes two mugs and goes to the kitchen, where Martin is standing over a large pot of rum on the stove.  He's still trying to pop his ears._

speaker: Daphne
text: Two more.

speaker: Martin
text: Almost there.  I just need to replace some of this rum that's boiled off.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, yeah, just what Annie needs.  She's all over poor Dr. Crane as it is, and after I begged her to leave him alone. Why couldn't she be hot for Frasier?

speaker: Martin
text: What?

speaker: Daphne
text: Annie -- hot for Frasier!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_looking out the door_] I should just forget about those two and concentrate on Guy.  Now he's the sort of tall drink of water I could really go for. _She leaves.  Martin obligingly opens the fridge and gets out a bottle of spring water, and turns just in time to see Frasier come in._

speaker: Martin
text: Here you go.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, thank you, Dad, but actually it's the rum I'm interested in.  I think it's just the thing I need to clinch things with Annie.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, Annie, huh?  I know something about that -- she's hot for you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Says who?

speaker: Martin
text: Daphne.  She said, "Annie's hot for Frasier."

speaker: Frasier
text: I knew my charms would win her over!  My God, I should register this dressing gown with the love police. _Out in the living room, Annie is seated on the coffee table, facing Niles, with a sympathetic hand on his knee.  Niles is uncomfortable, while Daphne hovers disapprovingly._

speaker: Annie
text: Oh, I know the pain you're going through.  I mean, I've never been divorced myself, but my last boyfriend was... eventually. What you need is something to take your mind off it. [_gets up and starts to sit down on his lap_] I'll tell you what always works for me--

speaker: Daphne
text: [_grabbing her_] Time to go upstairs!

speaker: Annie
text: What for?

speaker: Daphne
text: I need to give you your birthday present.  It's in my room.

speaker: Annie
text: [_to Niles_] I'll see you in a bit. _They go upstairs.  Niles sighs with relief -- and starts as he notices Guy sitting right next to him on the couch. _

speaker: Guy
text: _Allo._

speaker: Niles
text: Hi.

speaker: Guy
text: Your friend Daphne, she did not like the way Annie was flirting with you.

speaker: Niles
text: No, she didn't, did she?

speaker: Guy
text: In fact, she dragged Annie right off to her bedroom.

speaker: Niles
text: I think I know what that means.

speaker: Guy
text: I think we both know.  Daphne was jealous.

speaker: Niles
text: [_elated_] She was jealous, wasn't she?  I don't believe it!

speaker: Guy
text: I am surprised by nothing.  You know, I think you did not like Annie's flirting either.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, was it that obvious?

speaker: Guy
text: Annie is not your... cup of tea?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, [_leans in; whispers confidentially_] Just between us, my interests lie elsewhere this weekend.

speaker: Guy
text: [_suavely_] Really?

speaker: Frasier
text: Rum's ready!

speaker: Niles
text: Ah.  Guy, perhaps you could help my dad with the drinks?

speaker: Guy
text: I am at your service.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Guy.

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne wants me!

speaker: Frasier
text: She told you that?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, no.  But Annie was flirting with me, and Daphne dragged her off to her room in a jealous rage!

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, no, Niles, Annie was not flirting with you.  She's hot for me.

speaker: Niles
text: I think I know when I'm being flirted with.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, please, Niles, you're going beyond the limit that time. You're delusional!  Next thing, you'll be telling me that Guy's after you!

speaker: Niles
text: All right, now you're dreaming things up...

speaker: Guy
text: How do you like your rum?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, it's kind of small, but it's got a nice view.

speaker: Guy
text: [_holds up his mug_] No, your rum.

speaker: Martin
text: [_seeing_] Oh, yeah, yeah.  Could you speak up a little?

speaker: Guy
text: [_speaking louder_] I wonder if it's clouded my judgment about something.  Your son Niles -- is it my imagination, or is he attracted to--?

speaker: Martin
text: Hold it right there.  It's not your imagination.  He's got it bad.

speaker: Guy
text: Really?

speaker: Martin
text: Mmm.

speaker: Guy
text: This is not a delicate subject for you?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, no, no.  Niles has had those feelings for years.  'Course, I didn't encourage it during his so-called marriage, but now that he's free, whatever makes him happy -- I say go for it!

speaker: Guy
text: You are a wonderful father. _Martin and Guy carry a tray of mugs into the living room.  As they come in, Daphne and Annie come back down, both wearing nightgowns. Daphne's is covered by a robe, while Annie only wears a flimsy sheath over her shoulders._

speaker: Martin
text: O.K., everybody, come and get it!

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne, just in time.

speaker: Frasier
text: Annie, that's a lovely gown.

speaker: Annie
text: Daphne just gave it to me.

speaker: Guy
text: [_knowingly_] I'll bet she did.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sipping_] Mmm, Dad, this batch is even stronger than the last one!

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah... first time I made this was for your mother.  I'd been wanting to pop the question but I was afraid she'd say no. This gave me the nerve to ask her and I got myself a great big "yes"... and that wasn't the only "yes" I got from her that night either. [_laughs_] Still scares me to think how close I came to chickening out, though.  You know, as you get older, it's not the failures you regret, or the times you made an ass of yourself.  It's the times you never even tried, when you just lost your nerve.

speaker: Frasier
text: Wise words.

speaker: Niles
text: Hear, hear.

speaker: Frasier
text: Faint heart never won fair lady.

speaker: Annie
text: I certainly hope that if a man fancied me, he wouldn't be afraid to take a chance, go for a bold gesture.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, we must never be too timid to pursue our heart's desire.

speaker: Guy
text: And not give a damn what the world thinks... right, Miss Moon?

speaker: Daphne
text: Indeed. [_giggles into her mug_]

speaker: Martin
text: Takes an hour to make one of these things, but it's worth it just to sit here and savor every sip. _Everyone agrees.  Then they all throw theirs back and replace their mugs on the table._

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm done.

speaker: Niles
text: Time for bed.

speaker: Guy
text: I'm ready.

speaker: Annie
text: Me, too.

speaker: Frasier
text: 'Night, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: What?  You're not going to bed already, are you?  Oh, fine. Goodnight.

speaker: Guy
text: Enjoy your rum!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I'd enjoy it more if it had a TV in it. _Martin turns out the lights in the living room.  Guy exits to his room. Annie and Daphne, slightly tipsy, exit also -- but to the rooms opposite the ones they took earlier.  Frasier and Niles stop. _

speaker: Niles
text: I thought Daphne's room was...

speaker: Frasier
text: They must have switched. _Frasier and Niles exit to their rooms.  Daphne and Annie come back out, giggling._

speaker: Annie
text: I took the wrong room.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, I thought we got that backwards.

speaker: Annie
text: Oh well, no harm done. _Daphne and Annie cross and go into their correct rooms.  Hearing voices, Frasier and Niles stick their heads out._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_whispering_] Annie?

speaker: Niles
text: [_whispering_] Daphne?

speaker: Frasier
text: Goodnight, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Goodnight. _They close their doors.  Guy, hearing Niles's voice, sticks his head out._

speaker: Guy
text: _Allo?_

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, hello.

speaker: Guy
text: [_whispering_] I know what you want.  Don't be timid -- go for it! _He disappears back into his room.  Daphne, atwitter, disappears back into hers.  Scene Five -- Niles's/Annie's/Guy's/Daphne's Rooms Let the Roundelays Begin!  NILES'S ROOM: After Niles closes his hallway door, he tiptoes over to the door connecting to the adjacent room and knocks. _

speaker: Niles
text: [_whispering_] Daphne! _No answer.  He opens the door and goes in.  ANNIE'S ROOM: Niles is alone in Annie's room.  In the bathroom there is a sound of gargling._

speaker: Niles
text: [_whispering_] Hello?  It's Niles!

speaker: Annie
text: [_muffled_] Wait just a minute.

speaker: Niles
text: I can't wait, if I don't say this now I may lose my nerve. I need you!  I've wanted you since the moment I laid eyes on you!

speaker: Annie
text: Oh, I feel the exact same way!

speaker: Niles
text: Annie!

speaker: Annie
text: I see you're surprised.  Well, I've tried to send you signals tonight, but as usual I was too damned subtle. _He backs slowly toward the door.  Annie climbs over the bed and slinks close to him._

speaker: Annie
text: Just promise me you won't mention this to Daphne.

speaker: Niles
text: My lips are sealed.

speaker: Annie
text: Not for long, I hope.

speaker: Niles
text: Come in!

speaker: Niles
text: [_saved_] Guy!

speaker: Guy
text: Niles, I thought I heard your voice in here.

speaker: Annie
text: What do you want?

speaker: Guy
text: Niles, you told me you wanted to see that thing.  You know, in my room?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh yes!  Thank you for reminding me.

speaker: Annie
text: What thing?

speaker: Niles
text: Won't take long.  I'll catch you later. _HALLWAY: Niles and Guy slip out of Annie's room.  They speak in whispers._

speaker: Niles
text: That was close!  I owe you a big one!

speaker: Guy
text: Your room?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, good point, Guy.  She's bound to hear me in there.

speaker: Guy
text: We can go in my room.

speaker: Niles
text: It's much safer.  No matter how hard I try, I'm bound to make noise.

speaker: Guy
text: Me too. _GUY'S ROOM: Niles and Guy come in.  Daphne is sitting up in Guy's bed in her nightie, grinning with girlish anticipation._

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne!

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane! _The grin disappears.  So does Daphne, as she pulls the covers over her head._

speaker: Guy
text: Miss Moon!  Is your room not satisfactory?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_mortified_] Oh dear, I seem to have made a dreadful mistake.

speaker: Niles
text: What are you doing in Guy's room?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_sees a way out_] Oh, is this Guy's room then? [_laughs nervously_] I was looking for Annie's room.

speaker: Guy
text: Oh, now it makes sense.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'll just go!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, wait for me.  The hall is horribly dark, I'll show you the way.

speaker: Niles
text: My room should be safe now.

speaker: Guy
text: Very well, I'll see you later.

speaker: Niles
text: [_not getting it_] Excellent, yes. _HALLWAY: Niles and Daphne meet Frasier emerging from the kitchen with a bottle of champagne._

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh... hello.  What were the two of you doing in Guy's room?

speaker: Daphne
text: Just saying goodnight.

speaker: Niles
text: Now we're off to say goodnight to Annie.

speaker: Daphne
text: Goodnight to you, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, thank you.  Uh, how long will you be with Annie?

speaker: Daphne
text: Just a minute or two.  Is that champagne?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  I was just delivering it to... Dad.  Well, carry on.

speaker: Niles
text: Before you see Annie, can you come to my room?

speaker: Daphne
text: What for?

speaker: Niles
text: There's something I need to tell you. _NILES'S ROOM: Niles and Daphne come in.  The lights are off._

speaker: Niles
text: This may come as a surprise to you--

speaker: Daphne
text: Annie!

speaker: Annie
text: Daphne!

speaker: Daphne
text: Didn't I tell you to leave Dr. Crane alone?

speaker: Annie
text: And now I see why!  You wanted him all to yourself!

speaker: Daphne
text: I do not want him all to myself!

speaker: Annie
text: Oh, I see!  It's a threesome you're after!  Well, I don't do those anymore.

speaker: Niles
text: There's obviously been some kind of misunderstanding here.

speaker: Annie
text: I don't see how.  You barged into my room not five minutes ago and told me how much you wanted me.

speaker: Daphne
text: You did?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, technically, yes--

speaker: Annie
text: Then as soon as this one bats her eyes, it's shove off, Annie! [_crying_] This is the worst birthday I've ever had!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Dr. Crane, I'm sorry.  I've ruined everything for you.

speaker: Niles
text: No, you haven't.  Those things I said to Annie, I can explain--

speaker: Daphne
text: No, no, no, it's none of my business.  I've had enough embarrassment for one night!

speaker: Niles
text: But... _She goes back to her room through the connecting door. Niles follows her.  DAPHNE'S ROOM: The lights are off.  As Daphne and Niles come in, there is the sound of a cork popping. The lights come up.  Frasier is lying in Daphne's bed, naked underneath the sheets.  The champagne bottle is in his lap, overflowing onto the bed._

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane!

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne! _He tries to sit up, cover himself, and catch the champagne in a glass, all at the same time._

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier!  You snake!

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry, wrong room!

speaker: Daphne
text: Just get out of here, right now! _Frasier gets out, wrapping the sheet around himself, and leaves with the champagne bottle._

speaker: Frasier
text: Next room I want, then?

speaker: Daphne
text: Just go!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, bye-bye, sorry again! _NILES'S ROOM: Frasier comes in.  The lights are off.  As Frasier closes the door behind him:_

speaker: Guy
text: _Bonsoir._ _The lights come up.  Guy is lying naked in Niles's bed, under the covers.  Seeing Frasier, he sits up._

speaker: Frasier
text: Guy!

speaker: Guy
text: You are not the Crane I want!

speaker: Frasier
text: You're not even the sex I want!

speaker: Guy
text: Where is Niles?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles?  Company!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh my God!  What are you doing in here with Guy?

speaker: Guy
text: Don't be jealous, Niles, it's not how it looks!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh. [_turns to go back, then_] WHAT?!

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, much as I'd love to stay and help you two sort this thing out, there happens to be a very beautiful woman on the other side of this door who wants me desperately!

speaker: Frasier
text: Annie!

speaker: Annie
text: [_screaming_] Aah!  Go away!  Get out!

speaker: Daphne
text: What's going on? [_sees_] Guy!

speaker: Annie
text: How dare you barge in on me when I'm naked!

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry!  My father told me you were hot for me!

speaker: Annie
text: Your father did?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Blame Daphne, she's the one who told him!

speaker: Daphne
text: I did not!  I said she wanted your brother!

speaker: Guy
text: Could Niles and I _please_ have some privacy?

speaker: Annie
text: [_to Niles_] You're just putting the moves on everyone, aren't you? _Niles is confused for a second, not sure whom to address first, then takes a little step towards his bed._

speaker: Niles
text: Would you kindly get out of my bed?  I am not gay, Guy.

speaker: Guy
text: Please, acknowledge your true nature!  Stop chasing these lesbians!

speaker: Daphne
text: _Lesbians?!_

speaker: Guy
text: Your father himself told me you wanted me!

speaker: Niles
text: My _father_ said I wanted _you?!_ _A five-way overlap ensues: "My father said what?" "Who are you calling lesbians?" "You're the most horrible family I've ever met," "Would everyone please just go to bed," "I've never been so humiliated in my life!" etc., etc.  Finally Martin comes in._

speaker: Martin
text: Hey!  Hey!  Hey!  Hold it down, there are people here trying to sleep! [_realizes_] Oh, my ears must have popped.  I can hear again! _He takes in the scene -- everyone standing around half-naked. _

speaker: Martin
text: Well, goodnight all.

speaker: Niles
text: All right.  We could discuss this till we've figured out every detail of what went on here tonight, but if you ask me, breakfast will be embarrassing enough as it is.  I suggest we all forget this ever happened, and just go to bed.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, wait, wait, wait!  Wait, everybody! [_everyone stops and looks at him_]  Let me see if I've got this straight.  All the lust coursing through this lodge tonight, all the hormones virtually ricocheting off the walls, and no one... was chasing me?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sighs_] See you at breakfast.
